definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: If this is love; is not fair.
sentences.chinese: 要是这就是爱情，素来就不平允。

sentences.english: The Chinese nation has always been ceremonies, reciprocity has become habit.
sentences.chinese: 中华民族素来是礼仪之邦，礼尚往来早已成为习惯。

sentences.english: Now I had not been beforetime sad in his presence.
sentences.chinese: 我素来在王面前没有愁容。

sentences.english: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣素来爱马大，和他妹子，并拉撒路。

sentences.english: 2in you I trust, O my God.
sentences.chinese: 我的神阿，我素来倚靠你。
我素来没说过任何人的坏话。

sentences.english: People never know to get away from them gracefully .
sentences.chinese: 人们素来不知道怎样从从容容地离去。

sentences.english: However, the Roads being reckoned as good as a Harbour.
sentences.chinese: 但这块锚地素来被认为是个良港。

sentences.english: China is a state of ceremonies, always to be convincing.
sentences.chinese: 中国是一个礼仪之邦，素来以得服人。

sentences.english: This time, always ineloquent of John Woo, but very embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 这下，素来不善言辞的吴宇森可是相当不好意思。

sentences.english: The rector had gone away for the day, being a man who disliked the sight of changes.
sentences.chinese: 教区长素来不愿意看到变动，所以整天都到外边去了。

sentences.english: But Canterbury would always be the city of the archbishop and monks of Christ Church.
sentences.chinese: 然而，坎特伯雷素来是基督教大主教和僧侣的聚集地。

sentences.english: British people are always famous for their conservative nature.
sentences.chinese: 英国人素来以保守闻名。

sentences.english: 6 (His father had never interfered with him by asking, 'Why do you behave as you do?'
sentences.chinese: 他父亲素来没有使他忧闷，说，你是作什么呢？

sentences.english: The sons also of them that afflicted thee shall come bending unto thee;
sentences.chinese: 素来苦待你的，他的子孙都必屈身来就你。

sentences.english: For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness: thou hast said, None seeth me.
sentences.chinese: 你素来倚仗自己的恶行，说，无人看见我。

definition: always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
prudent/cautious/to be in charge of ritual ceremonies/to hold an important office
